comments.body: or some other way to validate that the feature gate was actually set for the test

For the Windows E2E tests we manage the test configs at https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-testing/tree/master/job-templates and the test configs specify what feature gates are used.

We've got a separate issue for the Windows E2E tests where we don't have a good way to restrict test cases to only clusters with features enabled but we're working to solve that too.
you can try something similar to this: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/99612/files#diff-471e8786474b22c41fa2d0ca2a9c3950a7da2e0ac7ab6de638c505204b39bf8dR142

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@	ginkgo.It("should run as a process on the host/node", func() {

		ginkgo.By("selecting a Windows node")
		targetNode, err := findWindowsNode(f)
		framework.ExpectNoError(err, "Error finding Windows node")
